courses.description:
Level 3 of the Offensive Security program, Offensive Security Lieutenant (OSL), focuses on equipping you with the practical tools and techniques used in real-world hacking scenarios. In this course, you'll master essential hacking tools like Nmap for network scanning, Metasploit for automated exploitation, and Burp Suite for web vulnerability assessments. You'll learn how to perform vulnerability scanning on systems using tools such as OpenVAS and Nessus to identify security weaknesses.

You'll dive into the basics of exploit development, leveraging publicly known vulnerabilities and tools like Metasploit and MSFVenom to create working exploits. This chapter also focuses on hacking both Windows and Linux systems, teaching you how to exploit common misconfigurations and vulnerabilities in each environment. In addition, you'll explore the fundamentals of password cracking, employing brute force and dictionary attacks with tools like John the Ripper and Hashcat.

Web application vulnerability scanning is also a key focus. Learn how vulnerability scanners work, how to identify vulnerabilities and when to use the different mechanics and tools.

Whether you’re an aspiring ethical hacker or a security professional seeking to hone your exploitation skills, this course is designed to provide you with the hands-on experience and knowledge you need to take your offensive security skills to the next level.


Syllabus

Basic Hacking Tools: Overview of entry-level hacking tools such as Nmap, Metasploit, and Burp Suite for vulnerability assessment and exploitation.
Introduction to Vulnerability Scanning: Using tools like OpenVAS, Nessus, or Nmap to identify vulnerabilities in systems.
Basic Exploit Development: Overview of creating basic exploits using public vulnerabilities and tools like Metasploit and MSFVenom.
Hacking Windows: Exploiting common Windows vulnerabilities and misconfigurations for unauthorized access.
Hacking Linux: Exploiting Linux-based systems through common vulnerabilities and configuration flaws.
Password Cracking: Overview of password cracking techniques such as brute force, dictionary attacks, and tools like John the Ripper and Hashcat.
Vulnerability Scanning: Introduction to vulnerability scanning. Learn about the different techniques and tools.
target_audience: Aspiring ethical hackers and penetration testers who want to enhance their technical skills.
IT and cybersecurity professionals seeking practical knowledge of vulnerability scanning and exploit development.

courses.bio: The CCSK exam course is for IT professionals, security practitioners, and managers seeking cloud security expertise.
courses.description:
Certificate Overview
The Certificate of Cloud Security Knowledge (CCSK-V5) course provides essential skills such as Zero Trust, DevSecOps, Cloud Telemetry, Security Analytics, Artificial Intelligence, and best practices for cloud security, including the practical application of security controls in cloud infrastructures.
This course offers necessary training to pass the Certificate of Cloud Security Knowledge (CCSK-V5) exam on the first attempt. It includes over 100 practice test questions with detailed explanations to aid in exam preparation. The course features carefully crafted questions that simulate the real exam experience.
By completing the CCSK-V5 course, participants will be able to:
· Understand the fundamental concepts of cloud computing and its associated security challenges.
· Identify and implement appropriate cloud security controls according to industry standards.
· Evaluate and mitigate risks associated with cloud computing.
· Apply security practices to cloud applications and data.
· Understand legal, compliance, and regulatory issues related to cloud security.
· Utilize CCSK guidance to develop and enforce cloud security policies and procedures.


Key Features of the Certificate of Cloud Security Knowledge (CCSK-V5) Certification Course
· 1 Sample Practice Questions
· 2 Full-Length Mock Exams (90+ Unique Practice Questions)
· 1 Real Exam Questions
· Domain-focused Practice Tests
· Detailed explanations for each question and answer
· Reports to assess strengths and weaknesses


Prerequisites for the Certificate of Cloud Security Knowledge (CCSK-V5) Exam
There are no formal prerequisites for taking the CCSK-V5 exam. However, it is recommended to have:
· A basic understanding of security fundamentals such as firewalls, secure development, encryption, and identity & access management.
· Familiarity with zero trust strategy, artificial intelligence, cloud workloads, and application security, which are relevant to the updated CCSK V5 content.
· Proficiency in identity and access management processes within cloud security.


Skills Gained from the Certificate of Cloud Security Knowledge (CCSK-V5) Certification
The CCSK-V5 certification prepares candidates with skills to manage and secure cloud environments effectively. These skills include:
· Cloud computing concepts and architecture
· Cloud governance
· Risk, audit, and governance
· Organization management
· Identity and access management
· Security monitoring
· Infrastructure and networking
· Cloud workload security
· Data security
· Application security
· Incident response and resilience
· Related technologies and strategies
Mastering these domains equips candidates to streamline security operations, enhance security, and maximize the efficiency of protecting cloud infrastructure.


Who Should Attempt the Certificate of Cloud Security Knowledge (CCSK-V5) Certification Course?
The CCSK-V5 course is suitable for:
· IT Professionals
· Developers
· IT Operations
· Audit / Compliance Managers


Additional Updates on the Exam:
With the V5 update, the CCSK exam remains an open-book online exam. The V4 version will be available until January 1, 2026. While the V4 certificate does not expire, taking the V5 exam is required to obtain the V5 certificate.
target_audience: The CCSK is for IT professionals, security practitioners, and managers seeking cloud security expertise.

Secure & Optimize Your Network with pfSense – Learn Firewall Configuration, VPNs, IDS/IPS, Load Balancing & More
Course Description
Are you looking to master pfSense, the powerful open-source firewall and router? Whether you're an IT professional, network engineer, system administrator, or cybersecurity enthusiast, this course will take you from beginner to advanced in deploying and managing pfSense for network security, traffic management, and VPN configurations.
This course covers everything from installation to advanced security techniques, including firewall rules, VPNs (OpenVPN & IPsec), intrusion detection (Snort/Suricata), multi-WAN load balancing, VLANs, and high availability. By the end of this course, you'll be able to secure networks, optimize traffic, and troubleshoot firewall configurations like a pro.

courses.description:
Master the NIST Cybersecurity Framework – Udemy Course
Are you looking to implement the NIST Cybersecurity Framework (CSF) in your organization? This comprehensive Udemy course is designed to help IT and cybersecurity professionals understand, apply, and manage their risk posture using the NIST CSF.
Why Take This Course?
This course provides a practical, in-depth look at the NIST Cybersecurity Framework, making it an essential resource for cybersecurity professionals, business leaders, and risk managers. Whether you're new to NIST or looking to enhance your understanding, this course offers:
Expert-Led Training – Learn from experienced cybersecurity professionals.
Real-World Applications – Understand how the NIST framework applies across industries.
Risk Management & Incident Response – Gain insights into identifying, responding to, and mitigating cyber risks.
Comprehensive Coverage – Explore the framework's core functions, tiers, and implementation strategies.
What You’ll Learn
This course breaks down the NIST Cybersecurity Framework into easy-to-understand concepts, including:
Fundamentals of NIST CSF – Understand its components, importance, and industry applications.
Framework Core, Tiers & Implementation Profile – Learn how to structure and apply the framework effectively.
Cybersecurity Risk Management – Develop strategies to assess and mitigate risks.
Incident Detection & Response – Improve your organization’s ability to handle cybersecurity threats.
Compliance & Best Practices – Align your security policies with industry standards.
Who Should Take This Course?
This course is ideal for:
IT & Cybersecurity Professionals – Looking to strengthen their expertise in cybersecurity frameworks.
Business Owners & Executives – Seeking to enhance their organization’s cybersecurity strategy.
Compliance & Risk Managers – Needing to align with industry regulations and best practices.
Understanding NIST and Its Role in Cybersecurity
The National Institute of Standards and Technology (NIST) is a federal agency under the U.S. Department of Commerce that develops standards and guidelines to advance technology and innovation. Established in 1901, NIST plays a key role in promoting industrial competitiveness.
The NIST Cybersecurity Framework (CSF) is widely adopted by organizations to manage cybersecurity risks efficiently. It provides a structured approach to identifying, protecting, detecting, responding to, and recovering from cyber threats.
Get Started Today
If you want to build a strong foundation in cybersecurity and learn how to apply the NIST framework in real-world scenarios, this course is for you.
Enroll now on Udemy and take the next step in securing your organization’s future.
target_audience: Cybersecurity professionals
Information technology practitioners
Risk management practitioners
Business leaders and executives

courses.description:
Sensu is a powerful Next-Generation monitoring framework that is quickly replacing traditional monitoring systems like Zabbix, Icinga, and Nagios.
But diving into a new monitoring system can be difficult without a guide to show you the way! This course can be your guide to understanding how Sensu works and how to deploy it to your infrastructure.
This introductory course will teach you the basics of Sensu's architecture and how to take advantage of the flexibility it provides to build awesome systems.
Contents
In-depth architectural overview
All videos closed-captioned in English. Hear and See for optimal learning!
Step-by-step howto instructions on getting Sensu up and running
Leverage your existing Nagios plugins written in C, Python, or Bash
Take advantage of the plethora of Open Source Sensu plugins in Ruby!
Learn about RabbitMQ, Redis, Ruby Gems, Sensu's API, and more
Use Uchiwa, the awesome open source Dashboard for Sensu
Setup the foundation to build on more intermediate and advanced Sensu topics
When you are finished with this course you will have setup a complete monitoring solution that actually checks things and actually sends email. This is not a theoretical course, it is a practical one that leaves you with skills and infrastructure to build upon.
Let Me Make The Mistakes For You
It's one thing to read docs and get perfect copy-paste command line examples that work. It is another thing to be in real life watching a real engineer fight a live system and try to get it working! I purposely make mistakes just to demonstrate what happens when things go wrong. That gives me an excuse to troubleshoot the problem and then solve it. Then, when you encounter that same mistake in your infrastructure, you will know exactly what to do!
For Dev and Ops Alike
Sysadmins, Devops Practitioners, Infrastructure engineers, SREs, and simply curious software engineers should take this course to better their craft and learn more about what makes Sensu special. It is not your grandfather's monitoring system. It is a modern, scalable, flexible monitoring system with a great API to integrate with your infrastructure.
Even if you don't end up using Sensu in Production, taking this course will still level-up your monitoring game, by increasing the scope of your DevOps toolbox. So enroll today and check it out!
target_audience: *Sysadmins* who are sick of inflexible monitoring systems!

courses.description:
Welcome, in this course we will be exploring the exciting world of SOCMINT also known as Social media intelligence. If you are familiar with OSINT (Open Source Intelligence) then you probably are already familiar with the term SOCMINT, if you're not, then don't worry this course is designed to walk you through what SOCMINT is, why it's important, how to keep yourself safe, investigations and much more.
The use of social media has become more and more popular and important. Social media is often times used to communicate with others, get your news, keep up with friends, learn new things, get alerts, and a lot more. Social media can also be used and leveraged for misinformation, disinformation, crimes, stalking, background checks, skiptracing, and much more. The amount of information that can be found on social media is staggering and having the ability to find, curate, and determine what is real and what is fake is a critical skill that people need to have.
In this course we go by step by step in diving into SOCMINT and equally important some safety tips to keep yourself safe during your investigations. This is not a full OSINT course (There are several full OSINT courses on this platform including my own), this takes a part of OSINT concentrating on Social media.
I hope that you will find this informative and useful and please feel free to reach out with any questions (before buying the course, during or after you finish).
target_audience: Anyone that wants to learn SOCMINT and social media investigations

courses.title: Network Security Interview Questions Practice Test
courses.bio: Network Security Interview Questions and Answers Practice Test | Freshers to Experienced | Detailed Explanations
courses.description:
Network Security Interview Questions and Answers Preparation Practice Test | Freshers to Experienced
Unlock Your Potential with Our Comprehensive Network Security Interview Questions Practice Test
Embark on a journey to master the fundamentals of network security with our meticulously crafted practice test. This course is designed to bolster your understanding of network security concepts, ensuring you’re well-prepared for any interview scenario. Dive into our extensive collection of interview questions, mirroring real-world challenges and scenarios that you’ll encounter in the field.


Section 1: Basic Concepts of Network Security Begin your journey by establishing a solid foundation in network security. This section covers the definition and importance of network security, helping you understand its pivotal role in protecting information assets. You’ll encounter interview questions that probe into common threats and vulnerabilities, challenging you to think critically about potential risks. Learn to articulate effective security policies and procedures, and gain insights into comprehensive risk management strategies. We’ll also introduce you to various security controls and familiarize you with security standards and best practices that are essential for any network security professional.


Section 2: Network Protocols and Technologies Advance your knowledge with our practice test questions focused on network protocols and technologies. Decode the intricacies of the TCP/IP protocol suite and understand how protocols like SSL/TLS ensure secure communications. Explore the setup and maintenance of VPNs, the configuration of firewalls, and the operation of Intrusion Detection Systems (IDS). Our interview questions will also guide you through securing domain name systems with DNSSEC, and implementing robust wireless security measures using Wi-Fi Protected Access.


Section 3: Cryptography and Encryption Cryptography is the backbone of network security, and this section dives deep into its core concepts. Master the principles of symmetric encryption and asymmetric encryption, and learn how to utilize hash functions and digital signatures to maintain data integrity. Our practice test includes interview questions on establishing a secure Public Key Infrastructure (PKI), recognizing common cryptographic attacks, and applying critical cryptographic protocols such as SSH, SSL/TLS, and IPSec.


Section 4: Network Access Control Control who accesses your network with our comprehensive section on network access control. This part of the course covers various authentication methods, including passwords, biometrics, and tokens. You’ll learn about different access control models like DAC, MAC, and RBAC, the benefits of Single Sign-On (SSO), the mechanisms behind Network Access Control (NAC), and authentication protocols such as LDAP, RADIUS, TACACS+. Our interview questions will challenge you to apply these concepts in practical scenarios.


Section 5: Security Management and Incident Response Prepare to manage security incidents effectively with our detailed exploration of security management. This section equips you with knowledge on creating robust security policies and procedures, developing an actionable incident response plan, utilizing advanced Security Information and Event Management (SIEM) tools, leveraging cutting-edge threat intelligence, managing vulnerabilities proactively, and conducting thorough penetration testing.


Section 6: Network Security Tools and Technologies Get hands-on experience with essential tools that are integral to network security. This final section introduces you to antivirus software, Intrusion Detection and Prevention Systems (IDPS), network scanners, packet sniffers, SIEM tools, and Data Loss Prevention (DLP) systems. Our practice test questions will help you understand how these tools can be leveraged to safeguard networks against various threats.


By enrolling in this course, you’re not just preparing for an interview; you’re investing in a future-proof career in network security. Each section is meticulously designed with interview questions that cover all aspects of network security, ensuring you’re well-prepared for any challenge that comes your way.
Join us now on this transformative journey towards becoming a network security expert!
target_audience: Aspiring Network Security Professionals: If you’re at the beginning of your network security journey, this course will provide you with a comprehensive understanding of the field. The interview questions are designed to build your knowledge from the ground up, ensuring you have a strong foundation to kickstart your career.

Experienced IT Professionals: For those with experience in IT looking to transition into network security, this practice test will help bridge the gap. It covers advanced topics and scenarios that will challenge and expand your existing expertise.

Students and Graduates: Computer science students or recent graduates will find this course particularly beneficial. It’s an excellent way to prepare for job interviews and gain a competitive edge in the job market.

Career Changers: Individuals seeking to pivot into a career in network security will discover that this practice test provides the insights and practical knowledge needed to make a successful transition.

IT Managers and Team Leaders: Managers and team leaders responsible for network security can use this course to stay updated on best practices, emerging threats, and new technologies. It’s also a great tool for training teams and ensuring everyone is on the same page.

Security Enthusiasts: Even if you’re not looking to work in network security professionally, but have a keen interest in the topic, this practice test offers a wealth of information that will satisfy your curiosity and deepen your understanding.

requirements: Basic understanding of computer concepts

courses.description:
Welcome this course is a basic overview of Kali Linux 2021. We cover basic setup, terminal navigation, and some core operating system structure. This is a great course if you haven't really used Kali Linux at all and you want to get your feet wet. Remember that this is a basic overview of Kali Linux core functions. There are three main sections. The first is focused on why this course exists. The second section is on Linux basics including the file system, boot process, and terminal navigation and manipulation. The third section is on Linux administration and understanding users, permissions, groups, and understand permission at a deeper level. I do cover basics on checking services in the third section also. There is a single video in the fourth section that is about crafting a basic exploitable EXE and setting up a handler to perform someone first meterpreter shell.


Because this is an overview there is not a lot of practical examples, however I do have assignments that ask you to accomplish some tasks so that you can see how to accomplish certain things. These assignments are made to build retention and understanding of what was being covered in the course. Thank you
target_audience: You have no prior experience with Linux and would like to learn how to use Kali Linux
You want to learn how to set up a lab and hack your victims using Kali Linux
You have basic understanding of ethical hacking and want to learn how to do it using Kali Linux

courses.description:
This course gives an introduction to security architecture for the cloud. You as a cloud consumer must be able to docment, create and govern your security architecture. The purpose of security architecture work is to protect your data and services in the cloud from potential misuse from hackers and other unauthorized individuals. You have to know what the cloud service provider will do to protect you and what you have to take responsibility for yourself.
This course will teach you what type of focus you need when you start creating a security architecture and what steps you must complete in order to implement and document the security architecture you need for your cloud solutions The course will not go into cloud vendor sepcific details but point to relevant resources for further learning.
Did you know that, according to Gartner, through 2025, 99% of cloud security failures will be the customers fault?
Cloud misconfiguration is considered one of the highest ranking risks for cloud services and has already led to the exposure of billions of data records. This risk can be lowered considerable when having a structured approach to security architecture for the cloud and should the primary objective of completing this course.
Course contents:
Security Architecture
Cloud Computing
Shared responsibility model
Methodology and frameworks
Strategy, scope and context
Risk
Compliance
Logical security architecture
Layered defenses
Implementation and best practices

This beginner-friendly course introduces you to the fundamentals of cybersecurity awareness and the techniques used by attackers to trick users through phishing. Using Termux on Android, you will see demonstrations of how phishing simulations can be set up so you can better understand and defend against these threats.


The focus of this course is educational only — helping learners recognize, prevent, and protect themselves from online scams. No prior experience is required.


You will learn about:
- How phishing simulations are created for awareness and training purposes
- The role of Termux and Zphisher in demonstrating cybersecurity concepts
- How fake login pages are used by attackers to steal credentials
- Real-world examples of common phishing targets such as social media, email, and online accounts
- Best practices to secure your accounts and avoid scams


By the end of this course, you will:
- Recognize how phishing attacks work at a basic level
- Understand the mindset of attackers in creating deceptive pages
- Be able to identify red flags in suspicious links and websites
- Apply essential cybersecurity practices to stay safe online
- Gain confidence in protecting your digital identity


Important Notice: This course is intended only for educational and awareness purposes. The demonstrations are designed to help you recognize threats, not to use them illegally. Misuse of the knowledge for hacking or unauthorized access is strictly prohibited. The goal is to make you more aware of phishing techniques so you can protect yourself and others online.

Who am i?
An experienced instructor with over 10 000 happy students on udemy, i spend my time making complex topic reacheable for anyone wanting to learn and understand them. As a dad of a toddler, i know what it means to have to simplify things but even before all this i was already emerged in the world of training IT profiles in software test automation and performance testing, having gotten my neoload expert certification in Paris so i could teach that software in a 3 day course that would prepare staff for neoload certification. All this helped me when i gained some experience in bug bounties on Intigriti (You can find me as theamazingferret) in a short time, i decided to start up my youtube channel because people kept asking me the same questions and this was a way to help them better. People seemed to like my teaching and it blew to where we are today. You can find me on LinkedIn as Wesley Thijs or on youtube or twitter or even facebook as the XSS Rat.
What does this course offer?
During my time as a bug bounty hunter and pentester i found i liked the XXE vulnerability type quite a lot. In this course i explain to you where XXE stems from, what it entails, how to exploit it and even how to prevent it. Every video file has a full PDF covering the topics in detail. To finish off i will you show you how to exploit this vulnerability in a set of practical video's demonstrated on one of my old CTF machines and on the portswigger labs.
Not only will you learn how to find and exploit this vulnerability but i will complete your skillset by giving you general guidance on preventing this issue type.

courses.title: Splunk Basics Course
courses.bio: Complete hands-on tutorial about the process of logging and monitoring using the amazing and agile tool Splunk
requirements: Some prior knowledge about Linux operation system
You'll need a desktop computer (Windows, Mac, or Linux) capable of running 3 virtual machines. The course will walk you through installing the necessary free software.
courses.description:
Machines are trying to tell us something through logs, so they are a very valuable resource for IT departments to ensure that everything is working as expected and to give us an idea of what is going on in our IT environments which will help to respond faster to incidents.


In this hands-on course, we will learn how to set up a small virtual LAB to simulate real-world logging and monitoring scenarios, where we will collect logs from Apache web server and Fortigate firewall and send them to Splunk for storage, analysis, visualization and alerting.


I selected these two log sources specifically because they represent the majority of log sources you will find in your environment, so you can follow the same steps in the course to integrate different log sources in the future.


There are more complex log sources to integrate like logs that are pulled from database but they are not suitable to be discussed in an introductory course.


After we onboard logs to Splunk, we will search and explore data we received then we will add knowledge to it by extracting interesting fields in these logs.


At this point, our logs will be ready to be treated by Splunk Searching Processing Language (SPL) to create reports, dashboards, and alerts.


This course will make you ready to dig deep into more advanced topics of Splunk administration like,
High availability
Indexers clusters
Search head clusters
Deployments servers
Splunk Apps
Advanced SPL


But you have to walk before you run, so my vision for this course is to master the basics first to break the ice.


Note:
When the course was recorded Splunk version was 8.0.4.1, On 10-09-2022 I validated Splunk Enterprise 9.0.1 on my own test lab and the steps and instructions in this course still apply.
target_audience: Security engineers
IT Administrators
Security operations center engineers
Security incident handlers
Systems administrators
Anyone wants to explore huge log files/feeds
Anyone interested to learn Splunk

courses.description:
One of the challenges of writing programs is having the ability to pick up where you left off. Jupyter Notebooks do this very well because they allow for interactive running of code, keep results in memory, and empower data scientists and programmers everywhere to build interesting things.
Jupyter is an interactive notebook which allows you to run code right inside the notebook. This is good for many reasons:
Notebooks, like actual books, can be shared easily
While running a notebook, the "state", is remembered: run some code and it' remembers the results of that code
Notebooks easily layout the process of a given program into a story-like progression that anyone can pick up and use.
If you've never worked with Jupyter Notebooks before, I highly recommend that you do.


This course is about bringing Jupyter Notebooks to the AWS Cloud. We'll be preparing a AWS Virtual Private Cloud, Subnets, Internet Gateways, Route Tables, and more so that we can provision AWS EC2 instances securely and effectively.


Once we have an EC2 instance, we can configure nginx, supervisor, and Jupyter so we can run it automatically on a public IP address... check out the first video for more on this.
target_audience: Data Scientists looking to control their Jupyter notebook experience
Data Scientists looking for "pick up where you left off" usage of a jupyter notebook
Pythonistas looking to get into Data Science.

courses.title: Cyber Security Advanced Persistent Threat Defender Preview
courses.bio: Learn to intelligently detect and take down advanced cyber threats

Understanding APTs: Cyber Kill Chain & APT Lifecycle Part 1
Cyber Kill Chain & APT Lifecycle Part 2
Cyber Kill Chain & APT Lifecycle Part 3
Cyber Kill Chain & APT Lifecycle Part 4
Cyber Kill Chain & APT Lifecycle Part 5
Cyber Kill Chain & APT Lifecycle Part 6
Cyber Kill Chain & APT Lifecycle Part 7
Cyber Kill Chain & APT Lifecycle Part 8

requirements: Familiar with cyber exploits and breaches that have occurred in the public
courses.description:
Welcome to this FREE course preview of the Cyber Security Threat Intelligence Researcher Certification.
Cyber-attacks have become so sophisticated over the years, that a new term has emerged - Advanced Persistent Threat, which we will refer to as APT. An APT is a group of individuals that have both the means and the intent to launch persistent attacks against specific targets. Understanding these groups and their behavior is important when evaluating threats against any organization.
Hackers have traditionally targeted large corporations, but today small to midsize businesses are being attacked with the same type of highly sophisticated malware. These new strains of advanced malware are often referred to as APTs
Modern malware uses Advanced techniques such as encrypted communication channels, kernel-level rootkits, and sophisticated evasion capabilities to get past a network’s defenses. More importantly, they often leverage zero day vulnerabilities – flaws for which no patch is available yet and no signature has been written.
Modern malware is often Persistent and designed to stick around. It’s stealthy and carefully hides its communications. It lives in a victim’s network for as long as possible, often cleaning up after itself by deleting logs, using strong encryption, and only reporting back to its controller in small, obfuscated bursts of communication.
Many attacks are now blended combinations of different techniques. A common tactic for hackers is to initiate an APT with spear phishing. This involves sending a carefully crafted email that appears to be in the from of a known individual or business with a link to a malicious website or an infected download.
Once the initial breach is successful, attackers can further damage defenses by disabling security protocols, changing security settings or stealing passwords. Groups of highly skilled, motivated, and very well-funded attackers represent significant Threats because they have very specific targets and goals in mind – often financial gain from theft of credit cards and other valuable account information.
Here are the topics that we will be covering in this course. We will begin by going over the APT Lifecycle and teach you a structured approach to analyze and assess inherent vulnerabilities. We will teach you mitigation and countermeasures that may prevent an attacker from gaining a foothold into an organization.

courses.title: TCP, HTTP and SPDY Deep Dive
courses.bio: The dirty networking secrets web programmers never think about when designing their applications.

Impact of TCP and HTTP on web applicatio: The Problem and why do we care
TCP and HTTP deep dive - Q&A

requirements: Basic familiarity with Internet technologies, including IP, TCP and DNS.
courses.description: This course will tell you how TCP and HTTP (the transport and presentation-layer protocols used by web-based applications) impact the web application responsiveness and page load time. We'll look at waterfall diagrams created by web browser development tools, cover the intricate details of TCP and HTTP (including slow start, congestion windows and pipelining), and try to figure out whether SPDY (the next-generation HTTP from Google) makes sense. The course is delivered via short video lectures in which I gradually expose the problems your web browser faces when trying to fetch all components of a web site, and the solutions you could use to make the process faster. You can take your time and go at your own pace, or rush through the course and be done in an hour or two. However, I would encourage you to proceed slowly, build your own test environment (using your mobile device or WAN emulator like WANem) and explore what's going on behind the scenes with browser development tools and Wireshark.
target_audience: Advanced web application developers looking to squeeze the last drops of performance from their application.
Network engineers trying to understand the impact of the network on the application workload.

courses.title: Open Source Intelligence - OSINT
courses.bio: Internet Research and Intelligence
requirements: A computer with a good Internet connection and the desire to learn
courses.description:
Open Source Intelligence (OSINT) “is defined as any intelligence produced from publicly available information that is collected, exploited, and disseminated in a timely manner to an appropriate audience for the purpose of addressing a specific intelligence requirement”.
Open source knowledge originates before the web. Legislatures have long utilized papers, and later transmissions, to follow expected foes' military, political, or monetary plans and exercises.
In any case, with the ascent of the web and virtual entertainment, and online devices that can filter through tremendous measures of data, OSINT is presently more pertinent than any time in recent memory.
Knowledge organizations use OSINT to follow occasions, hardware like weapons frameworks, and individuals. These are the 'objectives of interest' (ToIs).
In any case, hackers use OSINT to distinguish specialized weaknesses as well as human focuses for phishing and social designing assaults. Accordingly, pen testing and security groups send comparable strategies to find and shut down shortcomings.
There is no single playbook for OSINT: most pen analyzers have their own techniques and favored devices.
This frequently begins with manual surveillance, and finding out about the objective subjects, including utilizing non-specialized sources like an association's yearly report, monetary filings, and related news inclusion, as well as satisfied on its sites and YouTube and comparative administrations.
"Anything you can acquire by means of online as well as by customary media examination can be utilized for OSINT. Also, one of the least difficult but best devices is utilizing web indexes,"
In this course you will learn the fundamentals of OSINT , you will know how OSINT works , you will learn about how Internet Research and intelligence helps in solving Digital Crimes.
target_audience: Anyone who is willing to learn about open source intelligence-OSINT

Disruptions happen. Cyberattacks, system failures, power outages, and even natural disasters can halt operations and cost your business time, trust, and money. This course provides a complete, step-by-step guide to implementing a disaster recovery (DR) plan that is not only effective but also compliant, practical, and audit-ready.

You will start by understanding the core principles of DR and then move into hands-on application using downloadable templates. Our model company, CloudCore Technologies Inc., will serve as your example throughout the course so you can see exactly how to apply every tool in context.
Key topics include Business Impact Analysis (BIA), Recovery Time Objective (RTO) and Recovery Point Objective (RPO) calculations, identifying risks and mapping them in a Risk Assessment Matrix, designing recovery strategies based on system tiers, and documenting procedures in a Disaster Recovery Plan Template. You will also learn how to run tabletop simulations, test scenarios, and post-incident reviews using professional-grade checklists.
By the end of the course, you will have your own fully functional DR plan, complete with recovery strategy worksheets, testing protocols, communication plans, and real-world examples. Whether you’re building from scratch or enhancing an existing plan, this course gives you the structure, tools, and confidence to lead disaster recovery with clarity and control.
Get ready to reduce downtime, protect critical assets, and ensure business continuity—step by step.

courses.description:
An excellent starting point involves addressing the question, "Why should one embrace automation?" If you're already immersed in the cybersecurity realm, you're likely aware of the significant advantages automation brings. However, if you're new to the field, consider the challenge of safeguarding your less tech-savvy relatives or friends from malware installations on their phones or falling victim to phishing emails. Now, envision multiplying that struggle by hundreds or thousands of people. Factor in the reality that malicious actors are actively motivated to target your organization, and a single successful attack could result in millions of dollars in damages for the company. Managing cyber risk entails preventing malware infections, detecting and mitigating ongoing attacks, ensuring compliance with corporate security policies, and more. Automation serves as an ally by assisting in handling these tasks.Python boasts several features that make it a favorable choice, including the following:
Popularity: There's a high likelihood that you are already familiar with Python to some extent. It's far easier to learn new ways to utilize a language you are already acquainted with than to start from scratch with a new language.
Simplicity: Python is relatively quick and easy to grasp, even for those unfamiliar with it. This simplicity proves advantageous for both learning purposes and swiftly crafting programs.
Power: Python boasts a plethora of robust libraries that can be effortlessly imported into your code. If you need to work with network traffic, utilizing libraries such as Scapy is much simpler than attempting to build the functionality from scratch.
target_audience: Computer science   professionals

AWS Identity and Access Management (AWS: AWS IAM - User, User Group and Policy

requirements: Basic IT knowledge
Introductory knowledge of AWS Cloud
courses.description:
Security is a crucial aspect of any application or any infrastructure you design or build. AWS IAM allows you to securely build and operate in AWS Cloud. AWS IAM interacts with almost every AWS service and authorizes every request you send to AWS cloud. Some of the concepts of AWS IAM are pretty unique (like roles), which may be difficult to understand and comprehend. In this training you will learn these concepts using real life analogies.


Using AWS IAM, you can create users who regularly login to access AWS resources, arrange them in a group for easier management, and let them assume a role (within or across AWS accounts) so that they can perform various aspects of their work in AWS cloud securely using temporary credentials. IAM Roles, also helps AWS services to access other AWS services securely.


For providing required permission to these identities, AWS IAM uses policies, which give you the granular control on the actions performed by these identities.


AWS IAM can also facilities adding external identity providers so your users don’t have to authenticate separately for using AWS Cloud.


Whether you are builder (developer, solution architect) or an operator (Systems Admin, Network Engineer, Security Consultant), AWS IAM helps you leverage AWS Cloud is the safest possible manner.
target_audience: Anyone who wants to learn how AWS IAM handles authentication and authorization
Someone who finds it complex to understand various aspects of AWS IAM

About The Course
The Mobile Defense Technology Security course addresses the unique challenges and solutions for securing mobile defense technologies. As mobile devices, communication systems, and portable technologies rapidly advance within defense environments, safeguarding their security is essential for national security and defense operations. This course explores the security of mobile platforms, data transmission, and communication in defense contexts, while also covering relevant regulations, risk mitigation strategies, and incident response tactics for mobile technology threats.
Course Highlights
This course teaches you about core aspects such as:
● Understanding the fundamentals of mobile defense technology and the security risks associated with it.
● Identifying and assess the vulnerabilities of mobile devices and communication systems used in defense.
● Implementing security measures and protocols to protect mobile defense technologies.
● Ensuring compliance with regulatory frameworks for mobile defense systems.
● Mitigating risks related to cyber threats targeting mobile technologies in defense environments.
● Developing secure communication channels for defense operations.
● Formulating incident response strategies for mobile defense technology breach
Mobile Defense Technology Security, will provide you with the knowledge required to develop an effective strategic approach to protecting mobile defense systems.

courses.title: Mastering CompTIA A+: Your Ultimate Practice Question Guide
courses.bio: Prepare for Success: In-Depth CompTIA A+ Exam Practice
courses.description:
This comprehensive CompTIA A+ practice course is meticulously designed to equip aspiring IT professionals with the essential skills and knowledge required to pass the CompTIA A+ certification exams and thrive in entry-level IT roles. The course covers a wide range of foundational IT topics, including computer hardware, networking, operating systems, and security, providing learners with a robust understanding of core IT concepts.


**Course Overview:**


**1. Hardware Proficiency:** Students will learn to identify, assemble, and troubleshoot various computer hardware components. The course covers everything from motherboards and CPUs to storage devices and peripherals, ensuring that learners can effectively handle common hardware issues and perform upgrades.


**2. Networking Fundamentals:** The course delves into basic networking concepts, including IP addressing, subnetting, and the configuration and management of network devices. Students will gain hands-on experience with network setup and troubleshooting, essential for maintaining stable and secure network environments.


**3. Operating System Management:** Participants will acquire skills in installing, configuring, and supporting multiple operating systems, such as Windows, macOS, Linux, and mobile OS. The course emphasizes practical knowledge for managing and troubleshooting OS issues, ensuring students can effectively support a diverse range of systems.


**4. Security Essentials:** Security is a critical aspect of IT, and this course covers fundamental security practices to protect systems and data. Students will learn to identify common security threats, implement basic security measures, and understand concepts related to physical and logical security.


**5. Software Troubleshooting:** Effective software troubleshooting skills are vital for resolving application and OS-related issues. The course provides detailed instruction on diagnosing and addressing software problems, utilizing command-line tools and utilities as needed.


**Learning Outcomes:**


By the end of the course, students will have a thorough understanding of IT fundamentals and be well-prepared for the CompTIA A+ certification exams. They will be able to confidently handle hardware installations and repairs, manage network setups, support various operating systems, and implement essential security measures. The course combines theory with practical, hands-on labs and real-world scenarios, providing a well-rounded education that prepares students for success in their IT careers.
target_audience: This course is ideal for aspiring IT professionals, entry-level IT technicians, help desk support staff, and anyone looking to gain foundational IT skills and prepare for the CompTIA A+ certification.

courses.description:
The ISO 27001:2022 certification is an internationally recognized standard for establishing, implementing, maintaining, and continuously improving an information security management system (ISMS). This course is designed to provide participants with the knowledge and skills necessary to effectively prepare for a certification audit according to the ISO 27001:2022 standard. The course will cover essential tasks that need to be addressed Before, During, and After the certification audit process.


Course Outline:
0. General information about audits
1. Before the audit
Choose a certification body
Review a non-disclosure agreement (NDA)
Request and check the audit plan in advance
Conduct a brief self-assessment
Check the mandatory ISMS documents
Prepare and send documents to the lead auditors
Take care of the auditors
Strengthen the motivation of employees
Hold an internal briefing meeting
Send a reminder to employees
Train your employees to avoid common mistakes
Prepare a detailed presentation about the company and the ISMS
Check again that the clear desk and clear screen policy is followed by employees
Print the most important documents
2. During the audit
Invite top management to the meetings
Adhere to high standards of communication
Hold a meeting with the ISMS team after each audit day
Take notes during the audit
3. After the audit
Check the audit report
Plan for improvements and corrective actions
Check the certificate
Discuss the results and thank the team
Join this course to gain the knowledge and skills necessary to successfully prepare for an ISO 27001:2022 certification audit and establish a robust information security management system within your organization.


!This is important! This course is not about how to implement an ISMS, but how to prepare for the certification audit when the ISMS is already implemented.

courses.description:
In today's hyper-connected world, communication systems form the foundation of every major technology—whether it's mobile networks, satellite transmissions, optical fiber internet, or IoT-based smart devices. This course, "Communication System: Get Zero to Hero," is meticulously crafted to help you master the theoretical concepts and practical applications of modern communication technologies through 800+ practice questions. Whether you're a student preparing for exams, a professional aiming to solidify your concepts, or a tech enthusiast curious about how information travels through the ether, this course serves as your definitive practice-based guide.


You'll begin by strengthening your fundamentals in analog and digital communication, followed by in-depth practice across modern wireless, optical, and satellite systems. Complex topics like MIMO, OFDM, SDR, and 6G technologies are simplified through scenario-based questions to help you truly grasp real-world applications.


Throughout the course, we will reinforce core topics with focused Q&A sessions across key areas like:


Fundamentals of Communication Systems: Types of signals, key metrics, and system components.


Analog and Digital Communication: Modulation techniques, line coding, and signal reconstruction.


Information Theory & Coding: Entropy, channel capacity, error correction mechanisms.


Transmission Media & Antennas: Characteristics of wired/wireless media and antenna design.


Wireless & Optical Communication: Evolution of cellular systems, standards like Wi-Fi and ZigBee, and fiber-optic networks.


Satellite and Data Communication: Orbital mechanics, link budget analysis, OSI models, and switching techniques.


Advanced Topics: MIMO, OFDM, Software-Defined Radios, and cognitive radio systems.


Applications & System Design: Link budget, DSP usage, IoT communication protocols, and quantum communication.


By the end of the course, you'll not only be able to answer interview-style and exam-grade questions confidently but will also have a clear understanding of how different layers and technologies in communication systems interact in real-world applications.
target_audience: Engineering students preparing for semester exams or entrance tests.
Professionals revising for technical interviews in telecom and electronics.
Competitive exam aspirants (like GATE, ESE) needing communication system practice.
Enthusiasts seeking conceptual clarity and hands-on Q&A experience in communication.

requirements: No programming experience is required — everything you need to know will be covered in the course.
someone who has completed the “[THEORY Part] WEB HACKING For ABSOLUTE BEGINNERS” course
courses.description:
Course Description – Web Hacking for Absolute Beginners (Hand's On Edition)
Welcome to a beginner-friendly journey into the world of web hacking—designed specifically for non-developers and first-time learners.
This course is not about advanced exploits or complicated payloads. Instead, we focus on understanding how and whywebsites become vulnerable by examining them from the ground up.
Although this is the Hand's On Edition, you’ll still interact with code to built your own web pages—the kinds of sites that attackers typically target. Through this process, you’ll gain insight into how modern web applications are structured and where security flaws can hide.
We’ll use Burp Suite and Chrome Developer Tools to observe real-time web traffic, inspect request/response behaviors, and simulate basic interception techniques. These tools will help you understand how the browser communicates with a server, and how attackers might manipulate that process.
Rather than launching attacks, you'll learn to think like a hacker by debugging the web from both the inside and outside. Guided by a real-world white-hat hacker with multiple CVEs, each lesson emphasizes security awareness through hands-on observation and logical reasoning.
By the end, you’ll confidently identify potential weaknesses and better understand the fundamental principles of web security—no prior coding experience needed.


Let’s dive in and explore the world of web hacking—one step at a time.
target_audience: Beginner developers interested in hacking
Entry-level IT professionals curious about hacking

requirements: Basic experience with object-oriented programming and Java development workflows (Maven or Gradle).
Solid understanding of core Java concepts such as classes, interfaces, exceptions, and generics.
Familiarity with Spring Boot and dependency injection is recommended, but not strictly required.
Some exposure to networking concepts (HTTP, TCP/IP) will be helpful but not mandatory.
courses.description:
Are you tired of just using frameworks and libraries without knowing how they work inside?


This course teaches you how to build a real-world RPC framework from scratch, with a strong focus on advanced Spring Boot techniques. You won’t just use Spring Boot — you’ll learn how to extend its internal mechanisms to support dynamic proxy injection, custom annotation scanning, Bean lifecycle hooks, and more.


You’ll start by building a Netty-based communication core, defining your own protocol, encoder, and decoder. Then, you'll integrate high-performance serialization using Kryo to efficiently transmit objects across the network.
Where this course truly shines is in its Spring Boot integration:
Use ImportBeanDefinitionRegistrar to extract the startup class’s metadata and scan interfaces dynamically
Implement SmartInitializingSingleton to scan all available RPC service methods at runtime
Use BeanDefinitionRegistryPostProcessor and FactoryBean to register and inject proxy objects automatically
Design custom annotations that trigger client creation and connection logic on application startup
You'll also implement service discovery, heartbeat detection, connection management, and fallback support — everything a production-grade RPC system needs.


Every single line of code is written from scratch — no black boxes, no magic.
By the end of this course, you’ll have built a complete framework similar in architecture to Dubbo or OpenFeign — but every single line is handcrafted, explained, and deeply integrated with Spring Boot.
target_audience: Java developers who want to level up from using frameworks to building them.
Backend engineers eager to understand the inner workings of RPC systems, serialization, and network communication.
Spring Boot users who wish to master its advanced extension points, such as custom annotations and bean lifecycle manipulation.
Engineers interested in middleware development, distributed systems, or building lightweight alternatives to existing tools like gRPC or Dubbo.
Experienced coders tired of repetitive CRUD work and looking for a technical breakthrough.

Introduction: Welcome to Understanding Cyber Security course set

Network Routing - how packets are transmitted over the network

DHCP protocol in Action -- valid transmission and threats

requirements: Entry level course, attending "Understanding Cyber Security parts 1 and 2" is recommended
courses.description:
This is the third course in a five-part series on network communication, which includes the following modules: Networks Fundamentals, The power of Wireshark, TCP/IP and beyond!, Network Communication Programming with Python and Cyber Attack Analysis. Together, these courses provide a comprehensive foundation in networking, combining theoretical knowledge with hands-on skills for analyzing, building, and defending networked systems. This series is designed for students who wish to develop a deep and practical understanding of how modern networks operate, how data flows across systems, and how vulnerabilities in these networks can be detected and mitigated.
This third course: Understanding Cyber Security part 3 - TCP/IP and beyond! provides a solid foundation and know-how across the most important protocols of the network - the Internet Protocol (IP), the Transmission Control Protocol (TCP) and various application-level protocols. It covers IP addressing and subnetting, message fragmentation and routing concepts, as well as ICMP (Internet Control Message Protocol) messages which support diagnostics and error reporting. It describes in detail both connection-oriented (TCP-based) and connectionless (UDP-based) application protocols, emphasizing their differences in reliability, flow control, congestion handling, and supporting use cases, including HTTP/HTTPS, DNS and DHCP, examining how they use symmetric and asymmetric encryption and operate over UDP and TCP to enable modern Internet communication.
Building on the foundation from the first and second courses, students will use Wireshark extensively to capture and dissect IP,  TCP and application level packets, interpret sequence and acknowledgment numbers, analyze TCP’s three-way handshake, and understand connection teardown. Special attention will be given to TCP reliability mechanisms such as retransmissions, flow control, and congestion control, along with common TCP and IP-based attack vectors, including spoofing, scanning, and denial-of-service (DOS) techniques. Students will gain practical experience in capturing, filtering, and dissecting application-layer traffic, distinguishing normal application level usage patterns from anomalies, and understanding the role of each protocol in end-to-end communication. Through hands-on labs, students will understanding their underlying encryption framework, and learn how to reconstruct application-level exchanges, trace protocol handshakes, and evaluate performance or failure conditions.
The course builds a strong foundation for understanding encrypted transmission, recognizing attack signatures, as well as testing protocol resilience, and prepares for advanced topics in secure network design and intrusion prevention covered in the subsequent courses of the series.
target_audience: This course is intended for every high school and university student, seeking knowledge and knowhow in cybersecurity. It strives to facilitate learning by thinking and understanding, and to promote students' proficiency in handling complex ideas and mastering cybersecurity software projects.

courses.description:
Welcome to "Firewall Mastery: VLANs, DHCP, & Advanced Routing Techniques" This comprehensive course is designed for network professionals, IT enthusiasts, and anyone eager to deepen their understanding of routing protocols and firewall configurations.
In today’s interconnected world, effective routing and robust firewall management are essential for maintaining secure and efficient networks. This course will equip you with the practical skills and knowledge needed to navigate the complexities of both dynamic and static routing while integrating firewall solutions to protect your network.
Practical implementations using popular firewall technologies such as pfSense, MikroTik, FortiGate, PaloAlto, and OPNsense.
What You Will Learn:
Fundamentals of Networking: Gain a solid foundation in networking concepts, including IP addressing, subnets, and network topologies.
Static Routing: Learn how to configure static routes, understand their advantages and disadvantages, and explore real-world use cases.
Dynamic Routing Protocols: Dive into popular dynamic routing protocols such as RIP, OSPF, EIGRP, and BGP. You will learn how to configure, troubleshoot, and optimize these protocols for your network.
Routing Tables: Understand how routing tables work, how they are populated, and how to interpret them effectively.
Firewall Basics: Get introduced to firewalls, their types, and their critical role in network security.
Integrating Routing with Firewalls: Discover how to configure firewalls to work seamlessly with both static and dynamic routing, ensuring your network remains secure.
Troubleshooting Techniques: Learn to identify and resolve common routing and firewall issues using practical troubleshooting methods.
Hands-On Labs: Engage in hands-on labs and practical exercises that allow you to apply what you’ve learned in real-world scenarios.
Best Practices: Explore best practices for implementing and managing routing and firewall configurations to enhance network performance and security.
Who This Course Is For:
This course is ideal for network administrators, IT professionals, network engineers, cybersecurity enthusiasts, and students in networking programs. Whether you are a beginner looking to build foundational skills or an experienced professional seeking to enhance your expertise, this course will provide you with valuable insights and practical techniques.
Join Us!
Enroll now and take the first step towards mastering dynamic and static routing with firewalls. Equip yourself with the skills to design, implement, and manage secure and efficient networks that meet the demands of today’s digital landscape. Let’s get started on your journey to becoming a routing and firewall expert!

courses.description:
Kali is a penetration testing Linux distribution created by Offensive Security. It holds a repository of multiple tools for security-related engineers including hacking wireless networks, web applications, databases, Reverse engineering, password crackers, and much more! As you can see, Kali is a versatile and powerful tool for anyone looking to do any cybersecurity-related work.


Keep in mind this is a basics course, which means this course is a beginner’s guide Ethical Hacking - Phase 1 – Reconnaissance. We will cover Active and Passive techniques, and the tools used to perform the information gathering and reconnaissance. The main purpose of information Gathering is getting to know the target systems. This is the first process in ethical hacking. Reconnaissance is a set of processes and techniques (Footprinting, Scanning & Enumeration) used to covertly discover and collect information about a target system.


The course is broken into three main sections, and an introduction section, and we wrap up with a project to ensure you understand the process of information gathering and reconnaissance. The goal is to provide you with basic knowledge to get you started so you can take it from there. Remember this is not a field that you have can walkthrough. You will have to grow and adapt as the environment changes.


Remember this is a basic overview of information gathering and reconnaissance, the hope is you get in, understand the principles. Work through the assignments and exercises to help solidify your understanding of the topics covered in this course.

requirements: All information in the course is presented in the simplest and most understandable form. No special knowledge is required to understand it. Even a child over 10 years old will understand it. There is only one requirement - you must start applying the knowledge you have gained in practice. It is not difficult, but you need to overcome your laziness to form the right habit. And you will definitely form it. But there are two ways to develop this habit. In the first case, after taking this course, you will immediately start using strong passwords and enjoy life. And in the second case, you will develop this habit after you have been hacked and there will be bad consequences. And I'm absolutely not kidding right now. There are only these 2 options, and I really hope you choose the right one.
courses.description:
This course lays the foundation for user security on the Internet. I talk about passwords and what secure passwords should be.
While many people think this topic is too simple and unimportant, statistics show that over 75% of Americans use insecure passwords for their accounts and become vulnerable to attackers.
If you don't take passwords seriously, you're putting not only your life at risk, but the lives of your family, friends, coworkers, and even complete strangers.
That's why I believe it's impossible to keep yourself safe online without understanding the topic of passwords. And only after that can you consider and explore more complex online security topics. I will definitely touch on these topics in my next courses.
This course will give you a comprehensive basic knowledge of passwords so that you don't become an easy target for hackers. I want you to never get caught up in the horrifying statistics of people who have been hacked by internet criminals.
When you go online, you are entering a very dangerous and aggressive world. There are certain safety rules that need to be followed. Otherwise, very big problems will be waiting for you. And the first rule you need to know is what your passwords should be!
target_audience: This course is for anyone who uses the Internet. It doesn't matter how old you are, it doesn't matter what your experience or profession is. If you connect to the Internet, you must take a basic information security course. Failure to do so can have very serious negative consequences. Experience and practical studies of information security specialists clearly show that even experienced users sometimes make the stupidest mistakes that lead to tragedy. Therefore, I recommend taking this course to everyone who uses the Internet, and therefore automatically becomes potentially vulnerable to attacks by malicious users.

courses.title: Clear CompTIA easily, real exam questions,
courses.bio: Security Architecture, Security Operations, Security Engg and Cryptography, Governance, Risk and Compliance
courses.description:
CompTIA CASP+ is an advanced-level cybersecurity certification designed for security architects and senior security engineers. Here's what you need to know:


Certification Details


- Exam Code: CAS-004 (previously) and CAS-005 (SecurityX, the new version)
- Duration: 165 minutes
- Number of Questions: Maximum of 90 questions, including multiple-choice and performance-based questions
- Passing Score: Pass/fail only, with no scaled score


Exam Domains


- Security Architecture: Analyze security requirements and design secure solutions (29% of the exam)
- Security Operations: Manage and monitor security systems, incident response, and threat management (30% of the exam for CAS-004 and 22% for CAS-005)
- Security Engineering and Cryptography: Implement secure solutions using cryptographic techniques and security engineering principles (26% of the exam for CAS-004 and 31% for CAS-005)
- Governance, Risk, and Compliance: Develop, implement, and manage security policies, risk-handling techniques, and compliance strategies (15% of the exam for CAS-004 and 20% for CAS-005)


Benefits and Career Opportunities


- Career Advancement: CASP+ certification can lead to senior-level positions, such as Security Architect, Cybersecurity Engineer, and Security Operations Manager
- Salary Potential: CASP+ certified professionals can earn average salaries ranging from $77,000 to $165,661 or more, depending on the role and location
- Industry Recognition: CASP+ is a DoD-approved certification and compliant with ISO/ANSI 17024 standard


Preparation and Renewal


- Recommended Experience: Minimum 10 years of general hands-on IT experience, with at least 5 years of broad hands-on security experience
- Study Materials: CompTIA study guides, CertMaster Practice, and online training courses
- Renewal: CASP+ certification is valid for 3 years, and renewal requires earning 75 Continuing Education Units (CEUs) or passing the latest version of the exam
target_audience: IT professionals, aspiring IT technicians, network administrators, security specialists, helpdesk support staff, and individuals seeking to start or advance their careers in information technology

courses.title: Crowdstrike CCFA Practice Tests
courses.bio: Bank of custom questions
courses.description:
The Falcon Platform Quiz Collection is a comprehensive set of multiple-choice questions designed to assess and reinforce knowledge across the full spectrum of CrowdStrike Falcon documentation. Covering over 60 official documents, these quizzes span essential domains of endpoint security, cloud security, threat detection, SIEM (Security Information and Event Management), policy configuration, and API integrations. Each document was used to generate 10 questions, resulting in a robust dataset that simulates real-world operational scenarios and administrative decision-making processes encountered by Falcon administrators, analysts, and security leads.
Topics include deployment and management of Falcon sensors on Windows, macOS, Linux, and cloud workloads; configuration of detection and prevention policies; investigation workflows using CrowdStrike Query Language (CQL); and Next-Gen SIEM correlation rules, dashboards, and parsing standards. Additional questions evaluate understanding of response features such as Real Time Response, Device Control, and File System Containment. Governance and user provisioning are also covered through SCIM integration, role management, and scheduled reporting.
This quiz bank is ideal for cybersecurity professionals preparing for the CrowdStrike Falcon Administrator Certification.


That being said, this is not a test dump. The questions were made directly from the documentation that is referenced in the Certification Exam Guide. The difficulty is in line with the real test. If you have not studied the suggested exam guide documentation, this may be difficult.
target_audience: Persons studying for the CCFA certificaiton

Are you preparing for the Cisco Certified Internetwork Expert Service Provider (CCIE SP) certification? This course is your ultimate companion!


The CCIE SP Practice Exam Preparation Course is designed for networking professionals who aspire to master the advanced skills required for designing, implementing, and troubleshooting service provider networks. Packed with challenging practice questions, detailed explanations, and real-world scenarios, this course will help you build confidence and identify key areas of improvement.


What you'll find in this course:


Comprehensive practice exams simulating the real CCIE SP written exam.


Clear, in-depth explanations for every question to solidify your understanding.


Tips, strategies, and insights to maximize your chances of success.


Whether you're a network engineer, an IT professional, or someone seeking to enhance their expertise in service provider technologies, this course will guide you step by step toward achieving your certification goals.


Take the first step in becoming a Cisco-certified expert—let’s get started!


The course primarily focuses on helping learners prepare for the Cisco Certified Internetwork Expert (CCIE) Service Provider certification exam. Key areas include:


Advanced Networking Concepts: Covering in-depth protocols and technologies used in service provider environments, including MPLS, BGP, OSPF, ISIS, and segment routing.


Practical Lab Exercises: Simulating real-world scenarios to enhance troubleshooting and configuration skills, essential for passing the hands-on portion of the CCIE SP exam.


Exam Strategy and Techniques: Offering tips on time management, tackling complex exam tasks, and understanding the exam blueprint.


Service Provider Solutions: Addressing the design, implementation, and optimization of service provider networks, such as VPN services, multicast configurations, and QoS.


Hands-On Practice: Encouraging the use of network simulation tools like Cisco VIRL or GNS3 for lab preparation.
target_audience: Who is this Course For? This course is designed for:  Aspiring CCIE Service Provider Candidates  Networking professionals actively preparing for the Cisco Certified Internetwork Expert (CCIE) Service Provider certification who want focused practice exams and real-world scenarios to enhance their preparation. Cisco Networking Enthusiasts  Individuals passionate about Cisco technologies and eager to understand service provider networks at an expert level. IT Professionals Transitioning to Service Provider Roles  IT professionals with foundational networking knowledge aiming to specialize in service provider environments and explore career opportunities in ISPs, telecoms, or enterprise networks. courses.title: Complete Networking Course: Windows Server Administration
courses.bio: Complete Windows Server networking training covering IP addressing, DHCP configuration, DNS zones & network security
objectives: Plan and implement IPv4/IPv6 addressing schemes with advanced subnetting, VLSM design, and routing configuration for enterprise multi-site networks.
Deploy and manage DHCP services with scope creation, failover configuration, security implementation, and PowerShell automation for high availability.
Configure DNS infrastructure including zone management, Active Directory integration, troubleshooting, and advanced administration with PowerShell.
Master network troubleshooting using command-line tools, systematic approaches, and performance optimization for Windows Server environments.
requirements: No prior networking experience required - this course starts with fundamental concepts and builds systematically to advanced enterprise configurations.
Willingness to learn hands-on networking concepts - no previous server administration or networking certifications needed to succeed in this comprehensive course.
courses.description:
Complete Windows Server Networking Course Description
Master enterprise network administration with the most comprehensive Windows Server networking training available!
Transform yourself into a confident network administrator with this extensive 168-lecture course that covers every critical aspect of Windows Server networking infrastructure. Whether you're starting your IT career or advancing your network administration skills, this course provides the hands-on expertise employers demand.
What You'll Master
IPv4 & IPv6 Implementation: Gain complete mastery of IP addressing fundamentals, from binary conversions and subnet calculations to advanced VLSM design. Learn to plan and implement addressing schemes for multi-building networks, configure supernetting for network expansion, and master both manual and automated IP configuration methods using GUI tools, command line, and PowerShell.
DHCP Service Mastery: Become an expert in Dynamic Host Configuration Protocol deployment and management. Install and configure DHCP servers in domain and non-domain environments, create and manage scopes with PowerShell automation, implement advanced features like reservations, relay agents, and policy-based assignments. Master high-availability configurations with failover modes, database maintenance, and troubleshooting techniques for real-world scenarios.
DNS Administration Excellence: Master Domain Name System implementation from fundamentals to advanced enterprise configurations. Understand DNS hierarchical structure, configure forward and reverse lookup zones, implement Active Directory integration with DNSSEC security. Learn comprehensive DNS client configuration, troubleshooting methodologies using command-line tools, and advanced administration including delegation, logging, aging, and scavenging procedures.
Network Infrastructure & Security: Design and implement robust network infrastructures with routing tables, traffic forwarding, and multi-subnet environments. Configure NAT, manage virtual switches with Hyper-V, and implement security best practices for DHCP and DNS services. Master PowerShell automation for network management and learn systematic troubleshooting approaches.
Practical Skills Development: Every concept is reinforced with extensive hands-on demonstrations and real-world scenarios. You'll work with actual Windows Server environments, configure multi-interface routers, implement failover solutions, and solve complex networking challenges that mirror enterprise environments.
Why This Course Stands Out
With over 100 practical demonstrations and step-by-step implementations, you'll gain the confidence to handle any networking challenge in Windows Server environments. The course progresses logically from foundational concepts to advanced enterprise implementations, ensuring you understand both the theory and practical application of each technology.
Perfect for IT professionals seeking network administration roles, system administrators expanding their skill set, or anyone preparing for Microsoft networking certifications. The comprehensive coverage ensures you're prepared for real-world networking challenges in enterprise environments.
Enroll today and become the network administrator your organization needs!
target_audience: IT professionals and system administrators who need to master Windows Server networking infrastructure for career advancement and enterprise environments.
Network technicians and support staff looking to upgrade their skills to network administrator level with Microsoft technologies and PowerShell automation.
Students and career changers pursuing networking certifications or roles in enterprise IT environments requiring Windows Server networking expertise.
Beginners starting their networking career who want comprehensive training in IPv4/IPv6, DHCP, and DNS administration with hands-on experience.
